key_risks: Regulatory and compliance issues, including Nasdaq non-compliance and ongoing legal investigations
Higher leverage with a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.45, indicating vulnerability to economic downturns
Sensitivity to economic cycles due to focus on underserved markets and real estate lending
Operational risks from dependence on third-party technology providers
Capital adequacy concerns and potential challenges in maintaining regulatory requirements
controversies: Nasdaq non-compliance notification for failure to file Q3 2023 Form 10-Q
Ongoing investigations by law firms into potential breaches of fiduciary duty related to the 2021 merger with CFBanc Corporation
social_issues: Focus on underserved markets and affordable housing, increasing exposure to economic and regulatory risks
Potential reputational risks from broader industry criticism of predatory lending practices
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and internal control concerns due to delayed financial filings
Legal investigations into fiduciary duty breaches and merger-related issues

sources.title: Broadway Financial Corporation Faces Regulatory Non-Compliance and ...
sources.snippet: Broadway Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BYFC), the parent company of City First Bank, National Association, has received a letter from the Nasdaq Stock Market LLC (Nasdaq) notifying them about their non-compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5250(c)(1). The reason behind the non-compliance is Broadway's failure to file its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the period ended September 30, 2023.
